text: [Music]
I think that AI uh has been a wonderful
field and has a great future and
uh some of the directions are less
interesting to me and less important
theoretically I think than others. Uh I
don't think it needs a champion. um
there's plenty of uh plenty of drive to
uh pursue this research in in different
ways. What I don't think is going to
happen and I don't think it's important
to try to make it happen. I don't think
we're going to have uh uh really
conscious humanoid agents uh anytime in
the foreseeable future. And I think
there's uh not only no good reason to
try to make such agents uh uh but
there's some pretty good reasons not to
try. Now that might seem to contradict
the fact that I worked on the COG
project at MIT which was of course an
attempt to to create a humanoid agent
cog and to implement the multiple drafts
model of consciousness my model of
consciousness on it. um uh we sort of
knew we weren't going to succeed, but we
were going to learn a lot about about
the the what had to go in there. And
that's what made it interesting is that
we
could see by working on an actual
project what some of the really most
demanding contingencies and requirements
and dependencies were. It's it's proof
of concept. you want to you want to see
what what works but then you don't have
to actually do the whole thing. Uh I I
compare this to um uh imagine the task
of uh of robotics of
of designing and building a robotic
bird which could fly around and you know
weighed weighed
uh three or four ounces could fly around
the room uh could catch flies and land
on a twig.
Um, is it possible in principle to make
such a robotic bird? I think possible in
principle. Um, what would it cost? Oh,
much more than sending people to the
moon. It would be it would dwarf the
Manhattan project. It would be a huge
effort and we wouldn't learn that much.
uh we can learn by doing the parts
uh by understanding bird flight and uh
bird navigation. We can do that without
ever putting it all together which would
be a colossal expense and not worth
there's plenty of birds. We don't need
it. We don't need to make any I mean and
we can make quai birds. We can make in
fact they are making little little tiny
robot surveillance flying things. uh um
they don't perfectly mimic birds. Uh
they don't have to. Uh and that's the
way AI should go as well.
